homepage.hero.title.message: From Satellite Data to Smart Decisions
homepage.hero.title.description: The main title on the homepage hero section

homepage.hero.subtitle.message: One complete platform to access satellite data, analyze, visualize, and make geospatial-based decisions. From data to insight, all in one cloud ecosystem.
homepage.hero.subtitle.description: The subtitle text on the homepage hero section

homepage.hero.button.description: The button text to read documentation

useCases.header.tag.description: Tag label for the use cases section

useCases.header.title.description: Main title for the use cases section

useCases.header.subtitle.message: Utilization of remote sensing data to support evidence-based policy making and strengthen national resilience in various strategic sectors of Indonesia.
useCases.header.subtitle.description: Subtitle description for the use cases section

useCases.common.learnMore.description: Button text to learn more about a specific use case

useCases.common.viewAll.description: Button text to view all use cases

useCases.useCase01.description.message: Regular detection of forest cover changes using optical (Sentinel-2, Landsat) and radar (Sentinel-1) data. Identify indications of land clearing and monitor vegetation recovery throughout Indonesia.

useCases.useCase02.description.message: Analysis of built-up area expansion trends (urban sprawl) to support regional planning. Monitor land conversion in suburban areas using long-term satellite archive data.

useCases.useCase03.description.message: Supporting national food security through rice planting phase monitoring and paddy field health. Identification of production centers and harvest prediction using multi-temporal satellite data analysis.

useCases.useCase04.description.message: Monitor coastline changes due to abrasion or accretion using Landsat time-series data. Identify tidal inundation areas (intertidal) for coastal zone management.

useCases.useCase05.description.message: Utilization of Sentinel-1 radar data to detect flood inundation, even when covered by clouds. Support rapid response by providing indicative maps of affected areas.

useCases.useCase06.description.message: Regularly monitor land clearing for open-pit mining areas. Identify landscape changes and mining ponds using a combination of optical and radar data.

ourServices.header.tag.description: Tag label for the services section

ourServices.header.title.description: Main title for the services section

ourServices.header.subtitle.message: Access a comprehensive geospatial data ecosystem to support innovation and strategic decision making. From open data exploration to advanced computing infrastructure for national needs.
ourServices.header.subtitle.description: Subtitle description for the services section

ourServices.explorer.description.message: Explore and access geospatial data available on our platform freely.

ourServices.sandbox.description.message: Learn programmatic data processing. Training environment for geospatial analysis development.

ourServices.maps.description.message: Interact directly with digital maps to get quick visual insights.

ourServices.webservices.description.message: Integrate satellite data directly into your applications via global web service standards.

ourServices.production.description.message: High-performance computing infrastructure support for national-scale data processing.

homepage.faq.subtitle.message: Information regarding background, data access, and collaboration.

homepage.faq.q1.message: What is the background of PIKSEL formation?

homepage.faq.a1.message: PIKSEL was established through a strategic collaboration with Geoscience Australia, adopting Open Data Cube technology similar to the Digital Earth Australia platform. This initiative aims to build national geospatial data infrastructure independence to support more accurate decision making.

homepage.faq.q2.message: Is a user account required to access data?

homepage.faq.a2.message: No. Most data and API services (WMS/WCS) on piksel.id are open to the public without registration. Account registration is only required if you want to use the Jupyter Sandbox service for private data processing and simulation.

homepage.faq.a3.message: We welcome collaboration with academics, researchers, and other institutions. You can contribute by developing analysis modules in the Sandbox, or contact our team directly for potential broader geospatial product development cooperation.

homepage.faq.q4.message: What types and formats of data are available?

homepage.faq.a4.message: Currently we provide Analysis Ready Data from Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2 constellations, and historical Landsat archives. Data is presented in Cloud Optimized GeoTIFF (COG) format to support fast and interoperable access.

homepage.faq.q5.message: How often is satellite data updated?

homepage.faq.a5.message: Our platform indexes new data daily. Satellites themselves pass over Indonesian territory every day but at different locations following their orbit paths. For a specific location, Sentinel-2 will return every 5 days and Sentinel-1 every 6-12 days.
